basics.name: Shengkai Tao
basics.label: Statistics and Data Science Student
basics.summary: Statistics and Data Science student at UNC Chapel Hill with experience in data analysis, machine learning, and business consulting.

work.name: Ernst & Young
work.summary: Contributed to risk consulting engagements for multilateral development banks and non-bank financial institutions, with a focus on regulatory compliance, internal controls, and organizational risk mitigation.
highlights: Conducted in-depth walkthroughs and control assessments across 4 major departments, uncovering 10+ key risk points and identifying critical compliance and operational inefficiencies
Leveraged Python and Excel to evaluate internal control effectiveness, perform risk scoring, and uncover areas for process optimization
Delivered actionable recommendations to improve enterprise risk frameworks and ensure alignment with international regulatory standards
Used Python pandas to analyze audit datasets, identify high-risk patterns, and support data-informed decision-making
Co-authored comprehensive audit reports with a focus on accuracy, clarity, and practical value

education.institution: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
education.studyType: B.S. Statistics and Data Science, B.A. Sociology

awards.title: Best Visualization Award
awards.summary: Won Best Visualization Award out of 58 teams for producing actionable and intuitive graphics that shaped client-facing business strategy.

skills.name: Programming Languages
keywords: Python (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, plotly, scipy, Selenium, PyTorch, )

projects.name: ASA DataFest 2025: Office Expansion Analysis
projects.summary: Analyzed U.S. commercial real estate transactions (2018-2024) to identify high-growth regions for office expansion in the tech, legal, and financial sectors.
highlights: Won Best Visualization Award out of 58 teams at ASA DataFest 2025
Developed treemaps and stacked bar charts using Python (matplotlib, plotly)
Engineered a Random Forest classifier to recommend optimal office locations, achieving 92.5% prediction accuracy

projects.name: Marketing Campaign Optimization: Decision Tree Model for Customer Targeting
projects.summary: Developed a machine learning model to predict customer responsiveness to marketing campaigns for iFood, leveraging customer demographics, spending habits, and platform usage data.
highlights: Conducted feature engineering and exploratory data analysis using Python
Implemented and evaluated Decision Tree models, achieving 88% accuracy
Addressed data biases and ensured compliance with Brazil's LGPD data regulations
